abstract: To appease regulators and rival browser makers in Europe, the company says it will change the display of a ballot screen.
snippet: To appease regulators and rival browser makers in Europe, the company says it will change the display of a ballot screen.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN  Microsoft has agreed to reconfigure its Windows operating system in Europe to address two main complaints from rival Internet browser makers, a concession that could lead to the settlement of its latest antitrust case before the European Commission.

headline.main: Microsoft Decision Brings It Closer to Settling Case
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Decision Brings It Closer to Settling Case
